docs.text:
Welcome to Bugyard Documentation


What is Bugyard


This is a very basic theme for MkDocs with the goal of demonstrating all of
the features with minimal HTML and CSS.

docs.title: What is Bugyard

docs.text:
Getting Starting


See the 
Home Page
. All the other pages are for demonstration purposes
with the navigation only.


var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting";
alert(s);
docs.title: Getting Started
Getting Starting

docs.text:
Follow these instructions to integrate Bugyard on your Javascript Single Page App:


1 - Embedding the Web Widget


Copy and paste this snippet before the 
 </head> 
 on every view where you want Bugyard to load:


```javascript




!function(){if("function"!=typeof window.bugyard){var a=function(){a.c(arguments)};a.q=[],a.c=function(b){a.q.push(b)},window.bugyard=a;var b=document.createElement("script");b.setAttribute("data-bugyard","57585e7682fe650f00688556"),b.setAttribute("async","async"),b.setAttribute("defer","defer"),b.setAttribute("src","https://bugyard.io/dist/widget/bugyard.min.js"),document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(b)}}();


````


2 - Managing Users


2.1 When your user logs-in your site


Once you have a logged in user on your site (after they have authenticated and you have their details available), call window.bugyard("setUser", {user_data}), where user_data is the data about the user.


window.bugyard("setUser", {
email: "rick@bugyard.io", // user email, required
name: "Rick Sanchez", // full name
id: "1234567890" // user id
});
The email parameter must be a String containing a valid email address. It is required.
The name parameter must be a String containing the user full name.
The id parameter must be a String containing your internal user id.


From now on, all feedback are created by and associated to your user "Rick Sanchez".


2.2 When your user logs-out your app
Simply call the window.bugyard("freeUser"); when the user logs-out your app:


window.bugyard("freeUser");
All the users new feedback will not be tied to your internal webapp user anymore.


3 - Trigger the widget from a custom element
Do you want to be able to trigger a feedback from a big button inside your webapp or from a link inside your header? We've got you covered!


Just add the data-trigger-bugyard-feedback attribute to your custom element and set it to true. Clicking on this element will trigger the feedback form.


For example:


Feedback

If you need, you can also hide the widget button. To hide the widget button, do the following call to the widget:


window.bugyard("hideButton");
docs.title: Single Page App
1 - Embedding the Web Widget
2.1 When your user logs-in your site

docs.text: 1 - Embedding the Web Widget Option 1: For logged-out visitors If your page is dealing with logged-out visitors, paste this snippet before the tag on every web page you want the Bugyard widget to appear: Option 2: For logged-in users with user data If your page is dealing with logged-in users, paste this snippet before the tag on every web page you want the Bugyard widget to appear: The email parameter must be a String containing a valid email address. It is required. The name parameter must be a String containing the user full name. The id parameter must be a String containing your internal user id. 2 - Trigger the widget from a custom element Do you want to be able to trigger a feedback from a big button inside your webapp or from a link inside your header? We've got you covered! Just add the data-trigger-bugyard-feedback attribute to your custom element and set it to true . Clicking on this element will trigger the feedback form. For example: Feedback If you need, you can also hide the widget button. To hide the widget button, the following object must be present inside your web page before the widget is loaded:
docs.title: Standard Website

docs.text:
If your page is dealing with logged-out visitors, paste this snippet before the   </head>   tag on every web page you want the Bugyard widget to appear:  <!-- Bugyard widget embed -->
<script type="text/javascript">
!function(){if("function"!=typeof window.bugyard){var a=function(){a.c(arguments)};a.q=[],a.c=function(b){a.q.push(b)},window.bugyard=a;var b=document.createElement("script");b.setAttribute("data-bugyard","57585e7682fe650f00688556"),b.setAttribute("async","async"),b.setAttribute("defer","defer"),b.setAttribute("src","https://bugyard.io/dist/widget/bugyard.min.js"),document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(b)}}();
</script>
docs.title: Option 1: For logged-out visitors

docs.text:
If your page is dealing with logged-in users, paste this snippet before the   </head>   tag on every web page you want the Bugyard widget to appear:  <!-- Bugyard widget embed -->
<script type="text/javascript">
!function(){if("function"!=typeof window.bugyard){var a=function(){a.c(arguments)};a.q=[],a.c=function(b){a.q.push(b)},window.bugyard=a;var b=document.createElement("script");b.setAttribute("data-bugyard","57585e7682fe650f00688556"),b.setAttribute("async","async"),b.setAttribute("defer","defer"),b.setAttribute("src","https://bugyard.io/dist/widget/bugyard.min.js"),document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(b)}}();
</script>
<!-- Passing user data -->
<script type="text/javascript">
window.bugyard("setUser", {
email: "rick@bugyard.io", // user email, required
name: "Rick Sanchez", // full name
id: "1234567890" // user id
});
</script>  The email parameter must be a  String  containing a valid email address. It is required.
The name parameter must be a  String  containing the user full name.
The id parameter must be a  String  containing your internal user id.
docs.title: Option 2: For logged-in users with user data
2 - Trigger the widget from a custom element

docs.text:
1 - Embedding the Web Widget


Install the Bugyard WordPress plugin for websites built on WordPress v4.2.0 and higher:


Go to your WordPress site admin.
Navigate to “Plugins > Add New”.
Search for "Bugyard" and install the official plugin.
You will be asked to provide your App Id that you can find just bellow:


test




You can also download and install the plugin from our official plugin page.
docs.title: Wordpress

docs.text:
Install the Bugyard WordPress plugin for websites built on WordPress v4.2.0 and higher:  Go to your WordPress site admin.
Navigate to “Plugins > Add New”.
Search for "Bugyard" and install the official plugin.
You will be asked to provide your App Id that you can find just bellow:  test  You can also download and install the plugin from our official plugin page.
